channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Kalayaan LGU names 6 sandbars, reefs in West Philippine Sea
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: In a move to assert sovereignty over the country’s territory, the municipal government of Kalayaan islands in Palawan has officially named sandbars and reefs in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Cruise operators rehire Filipino seafarers
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: More than a thousand Filipino seafarers have been recalled by foreign cruise line operators that will resume sailing to Europe and Mediterranean itineraries, but thousands more still have to wait another two to three months due to travel restrictions in other countries.

item.title: PNP chief denies having Baguio concert party
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa yesterday denied reports that he held a concert party at a naval base located in Baguio City as alleged by residents, but admitted to having dinner with PNP officials where he said social distancing and health protocols were observed.

item.title: House OKs alternative learning system bill
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Voting 224-0, the House of Representatives has approved on third and final reading a bill that aims to institutionalize the alternative learning system in basic education for out-of-school individuals.

item.title: ‘E-government to help curb red tape, corruption’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The use of information and communications technology in government transactions or “e-governance” will help eliminate red tape and corruption, Sen. Bong Go said yesterday.

item.title: PNP ramps up campaign vs cyberbullying
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Now that children are much inclined to stay online amid the pandemic, the Philippine National Police (PNP) has decided to ramp-up its campaign against cyberbullying among youth in social media.

item.title: TESDA to offer free contact tracing program
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Starting September, the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority will be offering a free contact tracing training program.

item.title: DILG: Aggressive contact tracing a game changer
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Five months into the pandemic, the Department of the Interior and Local Government said aggressive contact tracing could prove to be a “game changer” in the country’s efforts in battling COVID-19.

item.title: Repatriated Pinoys hit 135,290
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: A total of 135,290 overseas Filipinos have been repatriated by the government amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the Department of Foreign Affairs said yesterday.

item.title: Pharmaceutical group asks government: Reconsider drug price caps
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Pharmaceutical and Healthcare Association of the Philippines is calling on the government to consider other approaches such as subsidies, price negotiation and pooled procurement to improve access to medicines instead of having price caps.
